intro: Eutrema botschantzevii, commonly known as the Botchantzev's sea rocket, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of the Mediterranean. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, four-petaled flowers and capsule fruits. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils along the shoreline, where it is adapted to salt spray and strong winds. Its leaves are basal, linear, and often covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are usually bright yellow or white. Eutrema botschantzevii is an important species for coastal ecosystems, providing habitat and food for various insects and small animals.
